posts.title: I need Help With My Goats
posts.body: My chicken (kienyeji) have not been laying eggs since December. They are feeding freely in the compound and with some chicken mash which is given in the morning before letting them free. What could be the problem?

posts.title: My poulry birds died all over sudden
posts.body: Hey guys. Also anyone who has a lorry or transportation that does that route at least twice a week message me.Location is bomet county

posts.title: My goat
posts.body: Hey farmers Nani amewahi fikisha 10bags of beans per acre coz Mimi maximum huwa natoa per acre ni 4 bags of 90k .and the way beans ziko na bei poa.

posts.title: Did You Know - Merino Sheep
posts.body: Back in 2004, Shrek the Merino sheep hid in a cave for six years so he wouldn’t have to get sheared. But the time he was cornered and given his long-overdue haircut on New Zealand national television, there was enough wool to make 20 mens suits. In 2015, a sheep named Chris who was found in Canberra, Australia, unloaded 89-pounds of fleece. Unlike wild sheep or “hair sheep,” (breeds that naturally shed), the wool of domestic breeds like the Merino will just keep growing, according to Dave Thomas, the now retired head of sheep studies at the University of Wisconsin, Madison.
